title: FTC Probes E-Cigarette Sales and Promotional Methods
text:
The Federal Trade Commission said it is seeking information from six e-cigarette companies, including vaping startup Juul Labs Inc., to study the sale and promotion of their products as health authorities investigate a rash of illnesses and deaths linked to vaping.

The other companies contacted by the FTC are Nu Mark LLC, which is Altria Group Inc.’s vaping business; R.J. Reynolds Vapor Co., which is indirectly owned by Reynolds American Inc.; Fontem U.S. Inc., an American subsidiary of Imperial Brands PLC; Logic Technology...
description: The Federal Trade Commission is seeking information from six e-cigarette companies to study sales, advertising and promotional methods of their products as health authorities investigate a rash of illnesses linked to vaping.
